meanings.definition: To break off small pieces from (a hard material)
meanings.sent1: She chipped the rock with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: He chipped the wood to make it fit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The sculptor accidentally chipped off the nose of the statue.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence chipped away with each criticism.
meanings.sent5: The chipped paint revealed the vibrant color underneath.

meanings.definition: To make a small cut or notch in
meanings.sent1: He chipped a small piece from the edge of the table.
meanings.sent2: She chipped the glass while trying to clean it.
meanings.sent3: The barber chipped his hair by mistake.
meanings.sent4: His words chipped away at her self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The chipped arrow missed the target by inches.

meanings.definition: To become damaged by having a small piece broken off
meanings.sent1: The mirror chipped when it fell off the wall.
meanings.sent2: The plate chipped after being dropped on the floor.
meanings.sent3: His phone screen chipped after a hard impact.
meanings.sent4: Her heart chipped a little each time he lied.
meanings.sent5: The chipped tooth caused him discomfort while eating.
